page.title: 19St. George's Church.
page.content: The foundation stone of St. George's church was laid on the 29th of September 1876. It was opened for public prayer on July 20th 1880 by Edward Harold Browne the Bishop of Winchester. Before 1937 the church had parrafin lamps, but from 1937 onwards it had electric lighting. Reverend John Pepin, Rector of St. Ouen, was the first to arrange a confirmation service at the church. The window high up at the back of the building has a small beautiful stained glass window. Mr. C.E. Le Cornu of Vinchelez de Haut Manor suggested a church club in 1913 which was called Penny a Week club; it was to raise more money to complete the building of the chancel.
